meanings.definition: A mark or other indication of the existence or passing of something.
meanings.sent1: I found a trace of chocolate on my shirt.
meanings.sent2: The detective followed the trace of footprints in the snow.
meanings.sent3: The trace of laughter in the room made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness left a trace of warmth in my heart.
meanings.sent5: The trace of paint on the canvas told a story.

meanings.definition: A very small quantity or amount of something.
meanings.sent1: There was only a trace of sugar left in the bowl.
meanings.sent2: She added a trace of cinnamon to the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The trace of rain on the window was barely visible.
meanings.sent4: A trace of doubt lingered in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The trace of perfume in the air was delightful.

meanings.definition: To find or discover by investigation.
meanings.sent1: I will trace the source of the strange noise.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist traced the origins of the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent3: She tried to trace the missing sock but couldn't find it.
meanings.sent4: He traced his family tree back several generations.
meanings.sent5: The detective traced the suspect's movements carefully.
